result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher K. Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher K. Harris is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher K. Harris was found guilty of Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Review hrg set for 12/6/16 @ 9am.  P&P to provide written report by 12/2/16.  Expunction will be granted upon successful completion of probation.  DOC shall promptly notify the court, in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

records.addlTxt: Deceased 2/4/19

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Atty Hans Koesser appeared on behalf of deft.  No appearance by deft.  No action taken on expunction request.
from Agent re: RH on 12/6/16
Deft and Poster picked up bond refund ck #15CH075414
Rec'd ck#15CH075414 back from USPS - Moved left no address/unable to forward/return to sender
Bond applied; partial refund.  jk/cp  ck# 15CH075414
from Agent Priscilla Macias - deft has violations
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Hans Koesser.  Deft appeared @ 9:35am this morning.  Warrant vacated.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Count 2 is dismissed on State's motion.  Sentencing arguments heard.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for one year.  See conditions.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Expunction will be granted upon successful completion of probation.  RH set for 12/6/16 @ 9am.  Bond shall be applied towards financial obligations; balance may be returned to poster.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Atty Koesser appeared on behalf of deft.  No appearance by deft.  Atty Koesser reports the deft did not have a ride to court today.  BW authorized; $500 cash bond.  Court takes no action on bond forfeiture at this time.  If deft appears @ 9am on 12/4/15, he will beat the issuance of the warrant.
